Завидую тем, кто еще не проходил эту игру. Bioshock Infinite по части сюжета и целостности достоин находиться на одном пьедестале рядом с Mass Effect и Kotor. Проработка персонажей привязывает к ним с первого же знакомства (или со второго - как в случае, с парой Лютес). Элизабет - во время перестрелок непроизвльно следишь за ней, хотя в этом нет никакой необходимости; в эпизодах без нее - чувствуешь себя неполноценным.

1/5 игры погружаешься в атмосферу Колумбии, на 2/5 раскручивается маховик сюжета, а начиная с 3/5 игры (спойлер:[spoiler]восстание vox populi и наслоение миров[/spoiler]), мозг начинает медленно закипать. Про финал в словесной форме ничего выдать не смогу, кроме, разве что - с этим придется жить :)  последняя сцена после титров - как контрольный выстрел, который, на время прекращая агонию, оставляет дыру, генерирующую вопросы в стиле "а что если?", "а вдруг?". При этом понятно, что никаких "а вдруг?" нет, не было, не будет. Или будут, были и есть.

Bioshock Infinite. At first I was overly sceptical about this game, I had heard so much opinions about this game that I couldn't be sure, until i had played this through. Well Several hours later, after finishing the game, I had gained an opinion in this game.

infinite, is bit by bit starting to feel that they're making sequels because of sequels. But yet, it works in overall gameplay. Back in the Rapture times. It was most relying on the "you're outnumbered and outgunned, just survive" factor. But in infinite, they have given you more bullets to feed to Columbians, but still. the guns are little underpowered, yet the vigor patches that problem off.
I was a loyal fan of original Bioshock series. but now, This one includes that list.

Such a good game from graphics to storyline u can not fault it. The ending is a surprise twist which have u thinking and keep u pondering! Overall 10/10 
Hope the bioshock franchise keeps on going :)

Когда мне было 19 лет, и мы с Букером искали комстока Букер всё время как-бы невзначай крутился возле двери, и всё спрашивал, что ты там затихла, почему не взламываешь дверь? первый раз я промолчала, так он начал ломиться в дверь, и орать,что ты не взламываешь замок, что с тобой? начал материться, и говорить, что вообще отмычки искать перестанет, алсо, Букер ругался, если я вижу замок и не взламываю, причём не просто вконце диалога, а непосредственно после его начала, мотивировал это тем, что времени много тратим, и сам потом мне говорил: вот я убиваю, потом доболтаю, и ты так взламывай!
однажды я дверь взламывала, и слышу, Букер где-то у двери встал в отдалении, ну я замок доломала, и на пол накарачики присела, а там щель очень широкая снизу у двери, ну я в щель и смотрю, а там Букер на карачиках сидит и в щель смотрит, и мне говорит: ты чё? ебанутая? чё ты там делаешь?
Букер кстати всё время какие-то энергетики пьёт, чтобы убивать часто, убивает по 20 раз за замес, а потом говорит, что не помнит, и ещё у него кровь из носа идет. пиздец короче!
реальная история. я Элизабет

Fantastic. Beautiful environments, fun gameplay, and an interesting plot.

Что могу сказать. Замечательная игра со всех сторон. Графика на высоте, харизматичные и очень интересные персонажи, за которых хочется играть снова и снова, захватывающий и необычный сюжет держит в напряжении до конца, оставляя приятное послевкусие. Динамичные перестрелки (коридорность, с лихвой компенсируется красотой и проработанностью окружения) не дадут расслабиться ни на минуту. Тут и различные пушки в стиле стимпанк, и "магия" каждый найдет что-то по вкусу. 
Эта игра оставила приятные воспоминания, и займет почетное место в моей библиотеке.

I really love the theming, storytelling, art direction, sound design and voice acting in this game. The story has some problems, and doesn't mesh totally well with the gameplay, relying on a lot of typical AAA tropes, however that didn't prevent me from caring about its main character, Elizabeth, and the world of Columbia. People have many problems with the game mostly for its combat, and how it didn't live up to its promises regarding meaningful choice, but in my case, for this game, everything else was so good that those flaws are forgivable. For a linear campaign, it did the best it could, and will always mean a lot to me.

I love this game!!

It's good. The combat was a bit lacking, but still ok. The story was really good. You really need to pay attention to what's going on and it encourages multiple play throughs to better understand the story.  I think I still only understand what happened in terms of the broad strokes and not the finer nuances. Even Burial at Sea, which mostly takes place in Rapture, adds even more interesting layers to the story. It is a story that made me think after it was over and I do appreciate stories that can do that. The game is mostly very linear. There are big areas to explore and each area does have an optional side-quest. It does kind of strike a decent balance between the puzzle box structure of levels from the FPS glory days of yore and the straight line approach to level design of today. There is definitely some searching around to do, but there is still a lot of just moving the character forward.  That said, a lot of the linearity of the level design has to do with incorporating the narrative into an actual video game. While playing through this game, it made me think that the complex story was better suited for a movie or book. The actual game part has to take a break for long and frequent segments for plot development and general exposition. While the story was really good, it isn't necessarily fun to have to continually hold down the walk forward button just to experience the story continuing. It's like I'm watching a movie and I have to constantly hand-crank the projector to keep it powered on. After over a decade of trying to marry gameplay with movies, the results feel like the worst of both worlds. Watered-down gameplay with low-end CGI movies. But, I do recommend BioShock Infinite. The story and world are definitely worth experiencing and while the weapons weren't anything special, the combat was ok.

While I find it overrated, Bioshock Infinite does a lot right: it presents you with a lovely and interestingly flawed world, its characters are memorable and there are some interesting combat situations throughout.
However, I can't help feel that Infinite goes backwards from the original Bioshock, or fails to add enough to impress me.
The story and its climatic ending did hit me hard, and I'd say that is the main appeal of the game; but the gameplay is lacking depth and exploration, specially when compared to Bioshock. The Vigors end up not being that different from the original's Plasmids, and the game doesn't develop them enough to separate their usefulness, homogeneizing them in practice.
Play it for an above-average video game narrative, and an average gameplay experience with some high points, I'd say.

Ein wahnsinns Shooter mit einer Bioshock-Typisch packenden Story, abseits stupider Kriegsschauplätze des bekannten Einheitsbreis!

Eine Vielzahl an für dieses Genre untypischen Möglichkeiten und Fähigkeiten sorgen während der Schusswechsel für genügend Abwechslung. Grafikstiel, Setting und Storyline übernehmen parallel dazu die restliche Arbeit, um ein wirklich sehr gelungenes Spiel zu konstruieren.

Zugegeben, es hat eine Weile gebraucht, bis ich die (zum Teil aus den Vorgängern bekannten) Fertigkeiten der eigenen Spielfigur Booker mit den Möglichkeiten der Skylines und den Fähigkeiten von Elizabeth zu einem vernünftigen Ablauf in den Gefechten kombinieren konnte, was dem Spielvergnügen aber keinerlei Abbruch beschert hat.

Die Tatsache dass man immer nur zwei Kräfte und zwei Waffen gleichzeitig als Schnellauswahl bereit halten kann, engt in manchen Fällen doch ein wenig ein (nicht selten habe ich mich mit den Auswahltasten für die Kräfte vertan), sorgt dadurch dennoch eher für eine zusätzliche positive Herausforderung.

I would like to make a review of BioShock Infinite. 
*Warning, This does contain a slight spoiler. *
*Also note I haven't beaten the game yet.*

First of all, I have never played the first two BioShock games. So, realizing that I didn't need to know the back story of the two previous games is a definite plus.

There are some things that I love about this game, and there some things that I find a little bit annoying:

1) I love the graphics. The graphics are beautiful. Even on a GTX 650, they are amazing.
2) The story is really good. I'm only a couple hours into it (I think), and every time I play, it feels like I am actually there. Very immersive. This goes hand-in-hand with the rich graphics.
3) *Spoiler Alert* Elizabeth throws books at you when you first meet her. I mean, if I was her and a random dude dropped out of no where, I would of done the same thing.

Now, what I find a little bit annoying..
1) The keyboard controls are a little bit wonky. I don't want to hit 'Z' every time I want to zoom into the sights. Even though it makes since to have 'Z' as zoom, I don't think to hit it when I am under fire. So, I would personally recommend using a controller.

So far, I will definitely give this game a high mark and would recommend this game to any one, even if you haven't beaten the first two games.

Бывает крайне редко, когда игра завораживает не только сюжетом, но и графикой. А меня заворожить крайне трудно. Мои мысли как мотыльки кружатся в голове и только когда я играю в такие игры он просветляется, находятся новые пути для того, чтобы осознать мир по-новому. Чувство озарения, что дает эта игра тем, кто умеет видеть поистине волнует ум. Как говорила и рассказывала главная героиня игры Элизабет, дочь Букера «Существуют тысячи дверей". 
 Я считаю, что она права, вопрос в том куда и когда ведут нас двери нашего сознания. Игра пытается не навязать, а объяснить нам с вами что есть простые и одновременно сложные задачи перед которыми встает человек осознавая мир вокруг себя. Будет ли он сыпучим как тот что представлен в игре, или будет состоять из твердых констант что мир в котором мы живем? 
 Игра порадовала меня своим сюжетом, своим смыслом, своим вдохновляющим на новые измышления идейным корнем и стержнем. Рекомендую пройти эту игру...

If you love engaging stories and beautifully crafted environments, buy this game for sure! If you like good shooting mechanics, don't buy this game.

I love this game. It has a beautiful design and an amazing story so far (haven't finished it yet, had to upgrade my pc). It's a nice sidestep from the original two bioshock games, and I'm convinced they went in the right direction with choosing a different setting for Infinite. The old city of Rapture was really grim and dark, but after two games, it was time to move on. The world of Bioshock: Infinite is in big contrast with Rapture, quite literally. The graphics are amazing, and combined with the art design, the game looks just amazing!

The gameplay however has some flaws: The combat system isn't really that good. The weapons are pretty generic: Pistols, shotguns, machine guns, rpg's, the standard stuff. The two weapon system is a love-hate relationship for me. I don't like that you have just 2 weapons, and in a lot of situations, you really need the versatility of multiple weapons, because the 2 you have at the time are useless against certain enemies. It's not always a problem, since a lot of times there are multiple weapons lying around so you can switch up your weapons a lot. Positive side is that you have to plan ahead a bit and consider what situations you'll be going into, and scramble for weapons to adapt.

As far as Elizabeth goes, I actually like the idea of a character that follows you around and helps you at certain times. A lot of times she saved me with some extra ammo (which also makes the 2 gun problem a little less annoying) or a health pack. It's also good that she's not an escort character and she's actually not killable. 

The skylines are also a nice little addition to the game. They give you a lot of mobility and really gives you the feeling of speed.

I bought it when it was on sale and since then i haven't regretted buying it a single moment. I've played the first 2 Bioshock games and if you liked those, I can say that you will most likely enjoy Bioshock Infinite as well.

I used to say that story did not matter in a game if there was a lot to do and a lot of variety. This game proves me wrong. It is an amazing story based game. There are some bugs and glitches but that did not bother me, I was so wrapped up in the story and trying to figure out what was going on as I was playing (not confused just wanted to know the whole plot). There were Easter Eggs and hints at the ending through the game which were hard to pick up on. It is just a FPS nothing special but the story makes the game more than worth it! There are some different guns, some stradegy required at times and some pretty awesome special abilities. Plus the soundtrack in my opinion is pretty awesome too. Highly recommend!

Any game that leaves me dropping my controller, just saying "no... no that... no?!" because I was so in to the story makes it worth while. And just as a warning, it will hit your feels a little. haha Awesome game!

I love this game, and it was a great way to close the BioShock series. The characters are believable, and have depth. While I wish there was more customization to the weapons, they get the job done. The only serious complaint I have is the AI could have been more of a challenge. Even on the hardest setting, FPS veterans will have no trouble playing through this game.  Either way its worth the buy.

Overall I would give this a 8/10.

BioShock Infinite is a very pretty game, in all regards, from the envirnoment, to the characters, to the plot, and everything in between.  BioShock shows what dedicated artist can do given time, money and proper management.  The major weakness then is the gameplay, fights feel repeative and boring, kind of mundane.  Worst of all, with all the work that has gone into the rest of the game the lack of artistic merit in gameplay becomes very noticable.  That said the majority of the game involves exploring the world and the characters that inhabit it so in the balance Bioshock is still a fantastic game.
Still my favorite game of all time. Story, gameplay, and look are amazing.
